items.subject: Re: Houston AI Club Volunteer Needed
items.body:
Yo... I got you buddy. I can grab the beer from Eureka Heights. It's sort of on the way.



On Wed, Mar 26, 2025 at 9:16â€¯AM Leon Coe <leon@houstonaiclub.com> wrote:
Good morning volunteers!

We are almost one week out from the April Houston AI Club meetup!

We still need one Beer Fetcher to get the beer from Eureka Heights anytime between now and next Thursday. If you can volunteerÂ this would be a tremendous help!

Additionally, we are looking for one more setup volunteer to help us prepare before the event. You would need to arrive around 5pm and help set up food, signs, and chairs.

Thank you so much again for volunteering. Please reply to this email if you're available for either role!

Thank You!
-Leon

On Mon, Mar 24, 2025 at 8:26â€¯AM Leon Coe <leon@houstonaiclub.com> wrote:
Good morning fantastic Houston AI Club volunteers!

We are locking in the final preparations for the upcoming April meetup and have one remainingÂ role available: Beer Fetcher.

Your job will be to visit our great sponsor, Eureka Heights Brew Co, at their location near the Heights and pick up the 100 beers they are generously providing to us. Then just bring them in your car and arrive 45 min early to the April 3rd event so we can properlyÂ ice them down in our cooler.Â 

If you would like to volunteer for this role please respond to this email so I can coordinate the pickup with you and the brewery!

If you have not been assigned a role for the April meetup don't worry. We had many people volunteer and I will circle back with you after the April meetup to find the right role for you for the May meetup. Thank you again so much for volunteering!Â 

Even if you are not assigned a role for April you are welcome to get there 30-45 minutes early and help us set up - that's always extremely helpful!

Thank You,
Leon


--
Lucas Bazemore
https://bazemore.me
713-264-1320

items.subject: Re: Visiting Brazil
items.body:
Wow! Thank you for such an extensive write up!Â 

I will take your recommendation directly. At least 1 night in the city and 1 night on the beach.Â 

We're not the best, but we can certainly play sand volleyball!Â 

And wonderful! Then I'll keep you posted on the dates that we travel. If you're looking at places that are in the city, please include places that are within walking distance to your home too. We're not really "city" people from a traditional perspective. We just like the city if you can get aroundÂ without a car.Â 

On Thu, Mar 20, 2025 at 2:26â€¯PM Bruno <brunofcavalcante@gmail.com> wrote:
Hey man! Oh shit I totally missed your last email! Sadly, I wasn't much... been playing volleyball lately, so spent a lot of the time playing, then back home got my back hurting like hell from all the jumping ðŸ˜–

Yeah, I'll be free on those dates! Both of them. Yes, definitely.

I'd recommend you stay part of the period in the city, and then another part in one of the beaches around Fortaleza.

For Fortaleza, I don't know many Hotels to recommend, but I'd say one super close to Beira mar (ideally with ocean view, it's gorgeous there!).

For the beach near Fortaleza, I'd recommend one of these:
  • Porto das Dunas. It's a ~30 min car ride from Fortaleza. Super quiet/small city, but the beach is amazing and it's one of the best places in the state. There's a lot of really cool places there, so I'd recommend also getting something like this one (Golf Ville)Â https://www.tripadvisor.com.br/Hotel_Review-g303285-d12288580-Reviews-Brisa_DO_Golf_Ville-Aquiraz_State_of_Ceara.html
  • TaÃ­ba: ~60 min ride from Fortaleza. A little bit farther, but also a very famous beach around the state. Carmel Taiba is the best Hotel there:Â https://www.tripadvisor.com.br/Hotel_Review-g1193283-d19732327-Reviews-Carmel_Taiba_Exclusive_Resort-Taiba_State_of_Ceara.html
Taiba is more of a fisherman city â€“ much simpler. Porto das Dunas is where a lot of the people with more money on Fortaleza go to live after a while. Lots of remote workers work from there. For both these beaches, if you look for hotels/airbnbs you'll find some really, really cool places.Â 

I'll do some research on local Hotels in Fortaleza for you too, I'll keep you posted on what I find!

Thrilled that you guys are coming!! Btw, are you guys into volleyball too? We could play while you're here! We play beach volleyball regularly!

On Thu, Mar 20, 2025 at 4:02â€¯PM Lucas Bazemore <lucasabazemore@gmail.com> wrote:
Bruno,

I'd like to see what dates would work for you to visit Fortaleza.Â 

I'm looking at the dates of April 27th - April 30th or from May 5th to May 8th as dates we could fly fromÂ SÃ£o Paulo.Â 

Would you be free during those dates?

Also, do you have any suggestions of "where" in Fortaleza Kendall and I could stay that you'd recommend? It will probably just be me and her.

Cheers,

On Tue, Mar 11, 2025 at 10:05â€¯AM Lucas Bazemore <lucasabazemore@gmail.com> wrote:
Awesome! Are you free thisÂ weekend? Like Saturday during the day or anything?

And yes, I'm working on it. Kendall and my mom want to go to Rio, so I'm trying to see if we can do both.Â 

On Mon, Mar 10, 2025 at 4:33â€¯PM Bruno <brunofcavalcante@gmail.com> wrote:
Hey! Nope, not working on anything besides my current job at Warmly. Yeah, I'd love to hear it! Man, can't wait to hear about it in person, it'll be so cool to see you again if that works out!

Looking forward to hearing more about your plans!

On Sat, Mar 8, 2025 at 1:24â€¯PM Lucas Bazemore <lucasabazemore@gmail.com> wrote:
Perfeito! I'll keep you posted on my plans. I just need to convince my mom to come with us.Â 

Also, are you working on any projects / side projects?Â 

I'd love to catch up with you and show you a small software / AI project I'm working on.

Could be fun to collaborate if you're interested.Â 

On Sat, Mar 8, 2025 at 4:22â€¯AM Bruno <brunofcavalcante@gmail.com> wrote:
Nice!! Iâ€™m in Fortaleza â€“ Itâ€™s a beach town in northeast Brazil! Itâ€™d be great to see you again man!

On Fri, 7 Mar 2025 at 20:56 Lucas Bazemore <lucasabazemore@gmail.com> wrote:
Family is in Sao Paolo, but what city are you in?Â 

Weâ€™re planning our travels right now, so Iâ€™d love to see if we can get together!Â 

Cheers,


Lucas Bazemore
https://bazemore.me
713-264-1320


On Fri, Mar 7, 2025 at 2:22â€¯PM Bruno <brunofcavalcante@gmail.com> wrote:
Hey Lucas! Yep, I should be!! Oh man, that's great news!! Which city/cities are you planning to visit?

Subject: Declaracao
To: Lucas A. Bazemore <lucasabazemore@gmail.com>





Notaries are supposed to confirm a signature and not scrutinized the papers.
This is not the role of the notary.

Everyone is scared because it has to do withÂ citizenship.Â 
What are the powers of a notary public?
There are two primary responsibilities of Notaries: 1)Â Validate the signer's identityÂ and 2) Confirm the signer's willingness and awareness to sign the document or complete the transaction.

Subject: Declaracao

Notaries are supposed to confirm a signature and not scrutinized the papers.
This is not the role of the notary.

Everyone is scared because it has to do with citizenship.
What are the powers of a notary public?
There are two primary responsibilities of Notaries: 1) Validate the

items.subject: Passport / Visa Issues
items.body:
Hello,Â 

I'm having an issue with getting a visa to Brazil.Â 

This is the web reference number for my vfs.global request: BRA6812151800061275

I have applied for a visa to travel to Brazil as I have tickets to fly to Brazil on AprilÂ 19th for 2 weeks toÂ see family. I am currently an American citizen and my visa application was rejected saying that I need to update my Brazilian passport.

I don't have a Brazilian passport anymore. I had one I believe prior to when I turned 18 back in 2012 that my motherÂ handled,Â but then never updated. Since then the United States and Brazil have never acquired a visa to travel and an American passport was good enough and so that's how I had traveled to Brazil several times since then.Â 

However, now theÂ Gov is requesting that my Brazilian passport gets either updated or I have to renounce my citizenship ( I had no idea I had Brazilian citizenship ).

My issue is that I don't have any records of the old passport.Â It is completely lost. My mother doesn't have it either. I've tried to go through the onlineÂ system to replace the passport, but I don't have a CPF so I can't schedule an appointment with the consulate through the system.Â 

I would like to take whatever option is swiftest so that I can travel to Brazil. I would love to just have a simple visa and then update the passport at a later time or renounce the passport if necessary.Â 

My mother has reached out and has a conversation going on as well I believe. Her name is Carla Bazemore.Â 

Help would be greatly appreciated.Â 

I would also love to call and speak with someone on the phone too as that is easier for me.Â 

I do not have a Brazilian Birth Certificate either, just an American one. See attached. I've also attached a copy of my American Passport and a color headshot that I used to submit for the Brazilian eVisa, just in case it helps.Â 

Thank you,Â 

--
Lucas Bazemore
https://bazemore.me
713-264-1320

My sole intention is to visit family, and I would like to proceed with a standard tourist visa as a U.S. citizen. IÂ would like toÂ take the simplest possible route to resolve this.

I have already booked travel from April 24th to May 9th, 2025, and my fiancÃ©e, who is also an American citizen, has successfully obtained her e-visa. I would greatly appreciate your guidance on how best to proceed so I can ensure smooth travel without any issues upon entry.

Now that I am applying for a visa to travel to Brazil as an American, the
system is requesting either a valid Brazilian passport or a renunciation
document, neither of which I possess. My sole intention is to visit family,
and I would like to proceed with a standard tourist visa as a U.S. citizen.
I would like to take the simplest possible route to resolve this.

I have already booked travel from April 24th to May 9th, 2025, and my
fiancÃ©e, who is also an American citizen, has successfully obtained her
e-visa. I would greatly appreciate your guidance on how best to proceed so
I can ensure smooth travel without any issues upon entry.

Thank you for your assistance, and I look forward to your prompt response.

Best regards,

Reference Number : BRA6812151800061275


-- 
Lucas Bazemore

items.subject: Product Requirements Questionnaire
items.body:
Hey Brandon,Â 

Great catching up with you today!

I've linked an initialÂ questionnaire that I would use to help figure out the broader scope of the product that you're looking to build.Â 

This is meant to be exhaustive and some questions may feel redundant, but they attempt to address things from different angles. There are A LOT of questions and some may not be applicable. That's okay.

The way I've used this, and continue to use it, is to go through as many of these questions asÂ I can in 1 sitting. Then let it sit for a few days inÂ the back of my head, then go through it again. I might do that aÂ few times as new thoughts come up.

After that, you can send them back to me and we can review together. Then we can go from there. If youÂ have any questions, let me know!

Product Requirements Questionnaire

Cheers,Â 


--
Lucas Bazemore
https://bazemore.me
713-264-1320
items.body_plain:
Hey Brandon,

Great catching up with you today!

I've linked an initial questionnaire that I would use to help figure out
the broader scope of the product that you're looking to build.

This is meant to be exhaustive and some questions may feel redundant, but
they attempt to address things from different angles. There are A LOT of
questions and some may not be applicable. That's okay.

The way I've used this, and continue to use it, is to go through as many of
these questions as I can in 1 sitting. Then let it sit for a few days
in the back of my head, then go through it again. I might do that a few
times as new thoughts come up.

After that, you can send them back to me and we can review together. Then
we can go from there. If you have any questions, let me know!

Product Requirements Questionnaire
<https://docs.google.com/document/d/1WYKhUyzjjeYBdTb6cJ0JkK3NbmwzL6ugOLmo5jpqWYI/edit?usp=sharing>

Cheers,


-- 
Lucas Bazemore
https://bazemore.me
713-264-1320

items.subject: Yoga Contractor Template
items.body:
This is a very simple agreement.


YOGA INSTRUCTOR INDEPENDENT CONTRACTOR AGREEMENT

This Independent Contractor Agreement ("Agreement") is entered into as of [Effective Date] by and between:

Yoga Studio: [Studio Name] ("Studio")

Instructor: [Instructor Name] ("Contractor")

The parties agree as follows:

1. ENGAGEMENT

Studio engages Contractor as an independent contractor to provide yoga instruction at Studioâ€™s location or other approved venues.

2. TERM

The term of this Agreement shall begin on [Start Date] and shall continue until terminated as outlined in Section 7.

3. CLASS SCHEDULE & COMPENSATION

Contractor agrees to teach the following classes per week:

  • Number of Classes: [Number of classes per week]
  • Class Duration: [Length of each class]
  • Compensation: Contractor shall be paid $[Rate] per class.
  • Payment Schedule: Payments will be made [weekly/biweekly/monthly] via [Payment Method].

Alternative options:

  • Compensation could be a flat rate per class, per student enrolled, or a revenue-sharing model.
  • Payment could be structured as per-class, per-hour, or on a percentage basis based on attendance.

4. VACATION & LEAVE

Contractor shall provide advance notice for time off:

  • Standard Recommendation: At least [14] days' notice for planned absences.
  • Alternative Options: Notice could range from 0 to 30 days, depending on Studio policy.
  • Contractor is responsible for arranging a substitute instructor, subject to Studioâ€™s approval.

5. INDEPENDENT CONTRACTOR STATUS

Contractor acknowledges they are not an employee and are responsible for their own taxes, insurance, and benefits.

6. LIABILITY & INSURANCE

Contractor agrees to:

  • Maintain professional liability insurance of at least $[Amount].
  • Indemnify Studio from any claims arising from their instruction.
  • Follow all Studio safety and conduct policies.

7. TERMINATION

This Agreement may be terminated by either party:

  • Standard Recommendation: With 30 daysâ€™ written notice.
  • Alternative Options: Notice could range from 0 to 60 days, or immediate termination for cause (e.g., misconduct, repeated absences).
  • Studio reserves the right to terminate immediately for non-performance, breach of contract, or safety concerns.

8. STUDIO POLICIES & EXPECTATIONS

Contractor agrees to:

  • Arrive at least [Minutes] before each class.
  • Maintain professionalism and uphold the Studioâ€™s reputation.
  • Follow all Studio cleanliness, attire, and attendance policies.

9. DISPUTE RESOLUTION

Any disputes shall be resolved through [mediation/arbitration/court jurisdiction] in [Location].

10. ENTIRE AGREEMENT

This Agreement constitutes the entire agreement between the parties and supersedes any prior understandings.

SIGNATURES

STUDIO:

[Studio Representative]
Date: _______________

CONTRACTOR:

[Instructor Name]
Date: _______________




--
Lucas Bazemore
